is a cross-platform application designed for document development using structured mark-up languages such as XML, XSD, Relax NG, XSL, DTD. authors who want to edit XML documents visually without extensive knowledge about XML and XML-related technologies. The WYSIWYG-like editor is driven by CSS stylesheets associated with the XML documents and offers the option to switch off XML tags when editing an XML document. managing the history of a set of files that change over time and are stored in a central repository using a version control system.

It offers developers and authors a powerful Integrated Development Environment. Based on proven Java technology, the intuitive Graphical User Interface of is easy to use and provides robust functionality for content editing, project management, and validation of structured mark-up sources. Coupled with XSLT and FOP transformation technologies, offers support to generate output to multiple target formats, including: PDF, PS, TXT, HTML, JavaHelp, and XML.
is the XML Editor of choice for developers, authors, and integrators that demand high-quality output with a flexible and robust, single-source, structured mark-up environment.

This user guide is focused mainly on describing features, functionality, and the application interface to help you quickly get started. It also describes the basic process of authoring, management, validation of structured mark-up documents, and their transformation to multiple target outputs. It is assumed that you are familiar with the use of your operating system and the concepts related to structured mark-up. It is assumed that you are familiar with the basic concepts of a version control system.
